msgr 1.2.8
  • Reference
  • Release Notes

Reference

Create messages, warnings and errors

These functions create messages and write them to a log file

info()

Display a message, and record it in a log file.

warn()

Display a warning, and record it in a log file.

error()

Display an error, and record it in a log file.

Create messages, warnings and errors, if a condition is met

These functions create messages and write them to a log file

info_if()

Display a message, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

warn_if()

Display a warning, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

error_if()

Display an error, and record in a log file, if a condition is true.

Throw errors if a condition is not met

These functions can be used to assert variables are valid

assert()

Display an error if a condition is not met

assert_type() assert_class() assert_null() assert_atomic() assert_vector() assert_logical() assert_integer() assert_natural() assert_double() assert_number() assert_character() assert_factor() assert_list() assert_array() assert_matrix() assert_data_frame() assert_function() assert_formula()

Display an error if not the correct type

assert_empty() assert_names() assert_length()

Display an error if not the correct structure

assert_na() assert_in() assert_in_range() assert_char_length()

Display an error if not the allowed values

assert_file() assert_dir() assert_readable() assert_writeable() assert_url()

Display an error if a valid file or directory path

Try expressions and catch errors

These functions catch errors and write them to a log file

try_catch() try_silently()

Try to evaluate an expressions and capture any messages, warnings or errors

with_msgr()

Convert messages, warnings and stops into msgr messages

try_map()

Apply a function over a vector or list, capturing any errors to display at the end

try_pmap()

Apply a function over a list of vectors, capturing any errors to display at the end

Predicate functions

These functions help specify conditions

is_type() is_class() is_natural() is_number() is_factor() is_array() is_matrix() is_data_frame()

Check the variable type & class

has_names() has_length()

Checks the variable structure

is_na() is_in() is_in_range() has_char_length()

Checks the variable values

is_file() is_dir() is_readable() is_writeable() is_url()

Check file paths and directories
